intro: Cylindrolobus aliciae, commonly known as the Alice's cylinder lichen, is a unique member of the Lecanoraceae family. It is a foliose lichen that forms a thin, leaf-like thallus with a distinctive cylindrical structure. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on bark or soil in temperate regions. Its chemical composition includes various secondary metabolites that contribute to its ecological role. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
